knimeNode.name: Shapiro-Wilk Test
knimeNode.shortDescription: This node performs a Shapiro-Wilk test.

intro.p: The Shapiro-Wilk test tests if a sample comes from a normally distributed population. The test is biased by sample size, so it may yield statistically significant results for any large sample.
This node is applicable for 3 to 5000 samples, but a bias may begin to occur with more than 50 samples.
More information can be found at Shapiro–Wilk test on Wikipedia.

Hypotheses:
H0: sample comes from a normally distributed population.
HA: sample does not originate from a normally distributed population.

fullDescription.option: Significance level at which the null hypothesis can be rejected, 0 < α < 1.
Checks if the samples are leptokurtic, and if so uses Shapiro-Francia. Otherwise, falls back to Shapiro-Wilk.

ports.inPort: Input table with one or more numerical columns.
ports.outPort: Output table with the Shapiro-Wilk test statistic, p-Value, and acceptance/rejection of H0.
